snippet: Nigel Evans, a deputy speaker in the House of Commons, was being questioned about accusations of attacks on other men.
abstract: Nigel Evans, senior lawmaker from Britain’s ruling Conservative Party, is arrested and questioned by police over allegations of rape and sexual assault involving two men between July 2009 and March 2013; he is released on bail and ordered to report back for questioning.

byline.contributor: Sarah Lyall contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: Nigel Evans, a deputy speaker in the House of Commons, was being questioned about accusations of attacks on other men.

headline.main: British M.P. Is Questioned in Rape Inquiry
headline.print_headline: British M.P. Is Questioned In Rape Inquiry
